Name: Jar
Description: Pottery vase in the form of the ritual vessel for libations, used in the hieroglyphic script for the sound 'h+s'. The hes-vase has flat base, slender foot, convex body profile, a short narrow neck, and broad flat rim. This example is covered on one side by the accretion from the tomb in which it was found, at Beni Hassan in Middle Egypt. It dates to the early Middle Kingdom, about 1900 BC.
